question_text: A technician applies a firmware update to a printer, but afterward the printer fails to boot properly. What is the most likely explanation?
answer_options: The update was applied using the wrong operating system
The wrong firmware version was installed
The paper tray was not loaded
correct_answer: The wrong firmware version was installed
explanation: Using firmware intended for a different model or revision can render the printer unbootable or unstable. Always verify model compatibility before flashing firmware.
